lesson.title: Create a new Xamarin.iOS project using Xamarin Studio
lesson.description: Create a new Couchbase Lite project for Xamarin.iOS in Xamarin Studio

introduction.paragraph: This lesson describes how to set up the Couchbase Lite environment for Xamarin.iOS using Xamarin Studio on a Mac.

body.paragraph: Before you can build an app, you need to set up your development environment:

list-item.paragraph: Download and install Xcode from the Mac App Store.
Download and install the Xamarin Unified Installer.

body.paragraph: For more details on setting up Xamarin see the installation doc in the Xamarin Developer Center.

list-item.paragraph: In the Welcome Page choose NewSolution.
In the New Project window, select iOS > Single View App and click Next:
In the Configure your new project screen, enter CouchbaseEvents for the project name, choose a location to create the project, and click Create:
On the next screen choose a location for the project and click Create.

body.paragraph: To use Couchbase-Lite in your Xamarin.iOS project, you need to add the Couchbase Lite package from NuGet. You can do this using the built-in NuGet support in Xamarin Studio.

list-item.paragraph: Right-click (or Ctrl-click) the CouchbaseEvents project in the Solution Pad and select Add > Add NuGet Packages to open the Add Packages dialog.
Search for Couchbase Lite, select it from the list, and click Add Package to add Couchbase Lite along with its dependencies to the project.

body.paragraph: Running the empty app at this point verifies everying is set up correctly.

list-item.paragraph: In the Xamarin Studio tool bar, select an iOS simulator such as iPhone 5s
Click the Run button in the Xamarin Studio tool bar to launch the simualtor and run the app:
